text: Frederick Charles George (also known as Charlie George; born 10 October 1950) was an English footballer, most famous for scoring the winning goal in the 1971 FA Cup Final. ==Honours== Arsenal *Football League First Division: 1970–71 *FA Cup: 1970–71 *Inter-Cities Fairs Cup: 1969–70 Derby County *FA Charity Shield: 1975 Nottingham Forest *UEFA Super Cup: 1979 Individual *Derby County Player of the Year: 1976 == Personal life == George was born in Islington and joined Arsenal after leaving school. He was a member of the 1971 side that won the League and Cup double. He later played for Derby County, Southampton and Nottingham Forest. George played one game for the England international team. == Notes == Category:1950 births Category:Living people Category:Arsenal F.C. players Category:Derby County F.C. players Category:Nottingham Forest F.C. players Category:Southampton F.C. players Category:AFC Bournemouth players
title: Charlie George
